sentences.sContent: For serious offences, use is made of the pillory as well as of the cangue, which latter is a heavy square wooden board round the neck.
sentences.sContent_eng: For serious offences, use is made of the pillory as well as of the cangue, which latter is a heavy square wooden board round the neck.
sentences.sCn: 对严重违法者，既使用颈枷也使用手铐。 颈枷是戴在脖子上的一块沉重的方木块。

sentences.sContent: Criticising all with hardly more reverence than the indian would feel for the clerical band the judicial robe the pillory the gallows the fireside or the church.
sentences.sContent_eng: Criticising all with hardly more reverence than the indian would feel for the clerical band the judicial robe the pillory the gallows the fireside or the church.
sentences.sCn: 她几乎和印第安人一样，以不屑的态度批评牧师的丝带、法官的黑袍、颈手枷、绞刑架、家庭或教会。

remMethod.val: 著名戏曲《苏三起解》中苏三戴着的刑具就是pillory (颈手枷)

trans.tranOther: a wooden frame with holes for someone’s head and hands to be locked into, used in the past as a way of publicly punishing someone
